The Colonial Exhibition, Dutch: Koloniale Tentoonstelling, took place in Semarang, Dutch East Indies (now Indonesia) on 20 August through 22 November 1914. Colonial exhibitions were trade expositions. It was designed to "give a comprehensive picture of the Dutch Indies in their present prosperous condition." It was the first large scale exposition in the Dutch East Indies, and financed by the participating corporations with a subsidy from the Dutch East Indies government.
The architect was Maclaine Pont.
Exhibits
There were displays including companies, foreign states and areas within the Dutch East Indies. One area of the grounds had pavilions dedicated to cocoa, coffee, kapok, and tea.
Dutch East Indies
There was a Balinese, an Aceh pavilion central Java, and Semerang pavilions.
File:COLLECTIE TROPENMUSEUM Het paviljoen Diorama Midden-Java op de Koloniale Tentoonstelling in Semarang TMnr 60039526.jpg|Central Java diorama
Foreign states
There were pavilions from Australia, China, Formosa (Taiwan) and Japan.
File:COLLECTIE TROPENMUSEUM Het Chinese paviljoen op de Koloniale Tentoonstelling in Semarang TMnr 60039533.jpg|Chinese Pavilion
File:COLLECTIE TROPENMUSEUM Het Formosa Tea House op de Koloniale Tentoonstelling in Semarang TMnr 60039524.jpg|Formosa tea house
File:COLLECTIE TROPENMUSEUM Het Japanse paviljoen op de Koloniale Tentoonstelling in Semarang TMnr 60039534.jpg|Japanese Pavilion
Companies
There were pavilions from several companies including
German hardware manufacturing business Carl Schlieper,
the Netherland Indies Gas Company (NIGM),
Nestlé,
and
the Dutch shipping company Koninklijke Paketvaart-Maatschappij (KPM).
File:COLLECTIE TROPENMUSEUM Paviljoen op de Koloniale Tentoonstelling in Semarang TMnr 60039518.jpg|Carl Schlieper pavilion
File:COLLECTIE TROPENMUSEUM Paviljoens op de Koloniale Tentoonstelling in Semarang TMnr 60039529.jpg|Trocadero pavilion (left), NIGM pavilion (center) and the Nestlé pavilion (right)
File:COLLECTIE TROPENMUSEUM Paviljoen van de Nederlandsch Indische Gasmaatschappij (NIGM) op de Koloniale Tentoonstelling in Semarang TMnr 60039523.jpg|NIGM pavilion
File:COLLECTIE TROPENMUSEUM Paviljoen van de Koninklijke Paketvaart Maatschappij (KPM) op de Koloniale Tentoonstelling in Semarang TMnr 60039521.jpg|Koninklijke Paketvaart Maatschappij (KPM) pavilion
Legacy
The Aceh state pavilion was built in Acehnese style, without nails.
After the exposition, it was dismounted and re-erected as the Aceh Museum, where it and the Cakra Donya Bell also displayed remain.
